text: __NOTOC__ Eolla, Bishop of Selsey, was the successor of Eadberht, and seems to have previously been Abbot of Selsey, as he witnessed a charterAnglo- Saxons.net Charter S44 accessed on 25 August 2007 of Noðhelm together with Osric and Eadberht. He seems to have succeeded as bishop in either 716 or 717. His date of death is sometime between 716 and 731.Fryde, et al. Handbook of British Chronology p. 221 ==Citations== ==References== * ==External links== * Category:Bishops of Selsey Category:8th-century bishops
title: Eolla
